channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Prince Andrew’s Links to Chinese Spy Suspect Revealed by U.K. Court
item.description: A London immigration court upheld a ban on a Chinese citizen described as a “close confidant” of the prince’s, on the grounds of national security.

item.title: Prince Andrew’s Links to Chinese Spy Suspect Revealed by U.K. Court
item.description: A London immigration court upheld a ban on a Chinese citizen described as a “close confidant” of the prince’s, on the grounds of national security.

item.title: Shark Tank judge says you don’t need money or connections to get rich: ‘The top 1,000 richest people are self-made’
item.description: John, whose net worth is estimated at $350 million, thinks you don’t need privilege to make it big.

item.title: The CEO of UnitedHealth Group says company employees have been ‘barraged by threats’
item.description: In a new op-ed Andrew Witty expressed his shock at the backlash he and his staff have received since the shooting of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thomps...

item.title: McKinsey to Pay $650 Million in Opioid Settlement With Justice Department
item.description: A senior partner has also pleaded to obstruction of justice after destroying company documents.

item.title: In the age of Slack and Zoom, Jensen Huang still swears by email to keep tabs on every corner of Nvidia
item.description: "I’m looking to detect the weak signals. It’s easy to pick up the strong signals, but I want to intercept them when they are weak."

item.title: Space Force exec dodges question on alien life: ‘I’m not going to answer that’
item.description: Her comments come during a week of peculiar drone sightings across New Jersey that have left authorities baffled.

item.title: Canada’s Gas Brings Indigenous People New Money, and Old Worries
item.description: New export terminals on Indigenous land have reignited a generations-old debate over identity and environmental stewardship.

item.title: Live Updates: Joyous Syrians Overflow Mosques for 1st Friday Prayers Since al-Assad’s Fall
item.description: Crowds chanted and waved revolutionary flags in Damascus and other cities. The celebratory mood belied the challenges facing Syria’s new leaders as th...

item.title: Blinken Discusses Syria’s Future on Unannounced Visit to Iraq
item.description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken said he talked with Iraq’s prime minister about the situation in Syria, including efforts to encourage Syria to t...

item.title: Macron Appoints François Bayrou as France’s New Prime Minister
item.description: François Bayrou, a veteran centrist politician, is the fourth prime minister in a year, a record for France.

item.title: Broadcom is now a $1 trillion company as stock surges 20% on AI boom
item.description: Broadcom's AI revenue grew 220% to $12.2 billion this past quarter, pushing semiconductor revenue to a record $30.1 billion.

item.title: Macron Appoints François Bayrou as France’s New Prime Minister
item.description: François Bayrou, a veteran centrist politician, is the fourth prime minister in a year, a record for France.
